current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 respecting
		  the scoring of preventive health savings.

cosponsor.#tail:
)
			 introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is
			 amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 202 of the
			 Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974/s:202

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , or by the chairman or ranking minority member of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and
				Pensions of the Senate

Committee
				on Ways and Means of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall determine
				if a proposed measure would result in reductions in budget outlays in budgetary
				outyears through the use of preventive health and preventive health services.

text.#text:
Upon a request
				by the chairman or ranking minority member of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
determines that a measure would result in substantial reductions
				in budget outlays as described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974/s:202/ss:h/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, a description and estimate of the
				reductions in budget outlays in the budgetary outyears and a description of the
				basis for such conclusions; and

text.#text:
shall include, in
				any projection prepared by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974/s:202/ss:e
Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974/s:308
Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974/s:402
Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974/s:424

text.#text:
may prepare a
				budget projection that includes some or all of the budgetary outyears,
				notwithstanding the time periods for projections described in

term.#tail:
means an action that focuses on the health of the public, individuals and
				defined populations in order to protect, promote, and maintain health and
				wellness and prevent disease, disability, and premature death that is
				demonstrated by credible and publicly available evidence from epidemiological
				projection models, clinical trials, observational studies in humans,
				longitudinal studies, and meta-analysis, to avoid future health care costs;
				and

means the 2 consecutive 10-year periods
				beginning with the first fiscal year that is 10 years after the budget year
				provided for in the most recently agreed to concurrent resolution on the
				budget.
